description.narrative:
KSO FOUNDATION is a non organizations registered in Amuru district with the aim of supporting vulnerable/marginalized in terms of rights, health and empowerment. It works through bottom-top approach, peer to peer participation, consultations and past experiences,was able to identify Women Commercial Sex Workers and at risk youth aged 15-24 years old (CSW) male or female of 15-25 years old asthe project beneficiaries. Identification was and will continue to be based on self- made youth status index formand peer to peer support. The project beneficiaries were later on engaged in their problem identification and strategy design. This approach together with the three years experiences earned while managing similar projects but at border posts, facilitatedthe birth of this project.
The project is called Empowerment and Rehabilitation Initiative for Women Commercial Sex Workers and at risk youth aged 15-24 years old (ERI-CSW), with a focus on male <(>&<)> female youths 15-25 years of age and are practicing commercial sex work in the hot spots. Implementation of the project is proposed to cover three sub counties of Amuru district with specific focus on the Commercial Sex Hot Spots of Akurukwe in Lamogi, Paboo T/C in Paboo, Bibia and Elegu in Atiak Sub County.
Goal: Transform the socio-economic wellbeing of 2000 women commercial sex workers and at risk youth aged 15-24 years old in Amuru District northern Uganda.
Specific Objectives: To Educate and sensitize the target group to make informed choices regarding their lives. To empower the target population through life skill training in sewing, hair dressing, leather shoe making and brick making, VSLA principles and their established groupswith start-up of capital. To sensitize the general public by creating awareness on the social and economic position of the target group

participating-org.narrative:
KSO Foundation founded in 2006, by young professional and creative founder members. The Organization KSO FOUNDATION operated without registration for two years and later on registered with the national NGO board in Kampala. The members have implemented various projects in Northern Uganda as a team or individually. This activity were in the area of support for provision of basic health care, creating access to health services, food security, climate change, customized capacity building of human resource for health and community leaders, psychosocial support to victims of war, consultancy and research, monitoring and evaluation of local government heathprojects for impact. After registration, the organization had a board that prepared and placed the organization strategically to attract TASO, Uganda AIDS COMMISION and TROCARE as partners and donor in working to bring the life of the marginalized and the vulnerable people into a meaningful and dignified beginning.
2. ACHIEVEMENTS What have been the principal results in the past three years that contribute to significant, structural, sustained and positive improvement in the lives of men, women, girls and boys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurity and exclusion?
3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE The Vision:
Stewardship in advancing empowerment, responsibility, justice, effectiveness, efficiencies and accessibility of rights by marginalized and vulnerable groups for a healthy, meaningful and dignified life#
Mission Statement:
Mission: What is the current purpose of the organisation?
KSO FOUNDATION exists to realize quality for responsibility, justice, effectiveness, efficiency, accessibility and empowerment in social services provision, social protection and socio economic development from a local population oriented value. Institutional objectives: What are the principal changes the organisation seeks to achieve over the long term? We focus on the participation, empowerment, enabling environment, education, and health for our marginalized group through good and effective governance to attain a sustainable social protection and socioeconomic development
Field(s) of activity: What are the principal thematic and geographic areas in which the organisation works? Who are the social actors that benefit from the work? Most activities are designed around participation of the target group in what if affects them, empowerment of the target group, and enabling environment for target group and Education for the target group. All to provide for creation of alternative employment opportunities through skilling, sharing of information, education and training, promoting social integrity <(>&<)> rights, empowerment of CSWs and awareness creation for duty bearers including law enforcers to understand the CSW#s rights and to use less violent and more community-friendly approaches of crime prevention when dealing with CWS. The social actors that benefit from our work are women who practices commercial sex and are known asCommercial Sex Workers and at risk youth aged 15-24 years old.
4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING Analyse the environment in which the organisation works? Who are the other relevant social actors, including government and business, and what roles do they play? #In this context, what is unique about the position of the organisation?
There are key contextual issue including policies and operational environment that are not friendly but applicable to this project. For example, the Trafficking in Persons Act (2009) andthe Sexual Offences Bill (2010) are generally good but recognizes commercial sex work as illegal. Therefore it may not be protective of our target group but prosecuting. In addition, some government departments, individual or communities who wish to applythese policies may perceive this project as one that promotes commercial sex work.
As a respond, our relationship at all stages of the project shall be handled with great care and responsibility. In terms of the operational environment, coordinationisgenerally weak but partnership with existing structure is strong and cordial. For example Community development officers, Uganda Police services, Uganda prisons services, Commercial formers and Bar owners. The projects will therefore carefully 13 manage the relationship and strengthen coordination, collaboration and partnership with networks such as the CBO and departments already working in the area of youth, and will work closely to ensure we are not targeting the same people with the same activities.
4. FUNCTIONAL ORGANISATIONAL CHART (include below your organisational chart) How are authority and responsibilities structured? For each operational unit, indicate the job titles, number of people in each position, and if they are men or women.
Note: To be uploaded from the audited books of account separately.
